intro: Cambessedesia membranacea subsp. bahiana, commonly known as the Bahian membranaceus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hirsute stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its aesthetic appeal.
